sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: Welcome to Unit 35 of our English learning journey. In this unit, we'll explore the use of 'I'd better' and 'it's time'

sections.title: Definition
sections.content: to express suggestions, obligations, and the appropriate timing for actions. Let's delve into the key concepts.

sections.title: 'I'd better' for Suggestions and Obligations
sections.content: Use 'I'd better' to express a suggestion or to convey that it is advisable to do something.
points: I'd better finish my assignment before the deadline.
You'd better call your friend and apologize

sections.title: 'It's time' for Appropriate Timing
sections.content: Use 'it's time' to indicate that a particular action or event is appropriate or overdue.
points: It's time to start the meeting; everyone is here
It's time for you to make a decision about your future

sections.title: Examples
sections.content: Let's examine examples to illustrate the application of 'I'd better' and 'it's time'
points: I'd better study for the exam; it's just a week away
You'd better leave now if you want to catch the train
It's time to submit your application for the scholarship

sections.title: Recap and Summary:
sections.content: In summary, 'I'd better' and 'it's time' are expressions used to suggest actions and indicate appropriate timing. Pay attention to the urgency and necessity conveyed by these phrases.

sections.title: Additional Resources:
sections.content: For additional practice and reinforcement, consider exploring examples in language learning books and online exercises.

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.content: Thank you for joining today's lesson on 'I'd better … it's time …' Practice using these expressions confidently in various situations, and feel free to reach out if you have any questions. Happy learning!
